metadata.title: CVE-2022-29155 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In OpenLDAP 2.x before 2.5.12 and 2.6.x before 2.6.2, a SQL injectionvulnerability exists in the experimental back-sql backend to slapd, via aSQL statement within an LDAP query. This can occur during an LDAP searchoperation when the search filter is processed, due to a lack of properescaping.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29155` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldap-utils - 2.4.31-1+nmu2ubuntu8.5+esm5
libldap-2.4-2 - 2.4.31-1+nmu2ubuntu8.5+esm5
slapd - 2.4.31-1+nmu2ubuntu8.5+esm5
slapd-smbk5pwd - 2.4.31-1+nmu2ubuntu8.5+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openldap package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.31-1+nmu2ubuntu8.5+esm5').
